Details Screen Help

The details screen is design for you to be able to get a quick run down about your specimen.

Entering Information

You are able to enter the following details:

Specimen Type
Objective Lens
Comments

Date, Time and GPS data are retrieved from the image"'"s Meta data.

Date is recorded as YYYY:MM:DD (eg: 2018:12:31 - this would be th 31st of December 2018)

Time is recorded in 24 hours time HH:MM:SS (eg: 20:50:15 - this would be 8.50pm and 15 seconds)

If you do not wish for the GPS to mark the position please turn it off in you phone settings.

Please be aware that some phone cameras have GPS set to ON. Be sure it is unchecked if you do not wish for GPS to be added to the images meta data.
Also if you are located in a building the GPS co-ordinates may not register with the phone due to no GPS signal reaching your phone.

Note: In the case of the objective lens - if you are not using a microscope to document specimens - you can enter a value of 0



High Resolution Preview & Zoom

Step 1. Click on the image preview
Step 2. The High Resolution page will open
Step 3. Using Pinch Zoom (ie: two fingers) you are able to enlarge and move the image around for a better inspection of the image
Step 4. Press you Back button on your phone to exit this screen

Note: On some phones you will have to pinch zoom 3 to 4 times before it will zoom in and out



Using the Side Menu

In the side menu (three dots in the top right) you have a number of options:

Annotate
Crop
Save
Upload
Restore original
Delete

Annotate - Access the Annotation part of the app. Here you can add arrows, text and scales to your image. To find out more, you can enter the annotation screen and click on the help button.

Crop - Here you can crop your image.

Save - Save any details you have entered.

Upload - If you have logged in with your account you will see this option. If you are using the app as a Guest you will not see this option.

Restore original - For any reason you want to clear all annotation made, this will restore your image to the original version.

Delete - If you want to delete this image and related information. Warning - once deleted from the phone it cannot be retrieved. However of you have uploaded the image and data to your account, you can access it from the web portal.

Return to the previous screen by touching the Back button.

Annotate Screen Help

Here you are able add annotations your image.

Using the Side Menu

In the side menu (three dots in the top right) you have a number of options:

Calibration
Save
Clear

Calibration - Before you are able to place a scale bar and messurement you are required to calibrate the scale.
By selecting the calibration you are able to calibrate your scale (more information given on the calibration screen).

Save - This will save any annotations you make on the image. Be aware that once saved the only way to clear the annotations is to restore your image to the original one taken.

Clear - This will clear any annotations you have made that have not been saved to the image. Be aware this will clear all annotations that are not saved!


Adding Arrows, Text and Scale

Arrows - You can place arrows to point to parts of your specimen.You have a choice of white and black. Just press on the arrow icon to view your choice.

Text - You can place text to describe parts of your specimen that arrows points to. You have a choice of white and black. Just press on the arrow icon to view your choice.

Scale Bar and Measurement - You can place a scale bar and measurement. You have a choice of white and black. Just press on the arrow icon to view your choice.
Please note: that you must calibrate first before you can use this. If you have not done the calibration you will get an error message instructing you to do so. Only one scale bar can be placed on the image at any one time.

When adding arrows and text you will see a red cross icon , red rotate icon and red arrow icon. These are there to assist you while using these features.
Red Cross icon - this will delete the asset you have placed on the image.
Red rotate icon - press and move to rotate the asset.
Red Arrow icon - press and move in either direction of the red arrows to increase or decrease the size of the asset.

Return to the previous screen by touching the Back button.
